title: Test failures with scikit-learn > 1.2
body:
`load_boston` was deprecated in 1.0 and was removed in 1.2 by `scikit-learn`. 

```bash
============================= test session starts ==============================
platform linux -- Python 3.10.10, pytest-7.2.0, pluggy-1.0.0
Matplotlib: 3.6.2
Freetype: 2.12.1
rootdir: /build/source, configfile: pytest.ini, testpaths: tests
plugins: mpl-0.16.1
collected 118 items / 1 deselected / 117 selected                              

tests/explainers/test_kernel.py .....xxx...                              [  9%]
tests/explainers/test_linear.py .....xxxxx...xxxxx                       [ 24%]
tests/explainers/test_permutation.py .sssssssss                          [ 33%]
tests/explainers/test_sampling.py ....                                   [ 36%]
tests/explainers/test_tree.py sxsssssss.x.xsxxx..x.xxxxxx.xxxx.ss.ssssss [ 72%]
sss                                                                      [ 75%]
tests/maskers/test_custom.py F                                           [ 76%]
tests/maskers/test_image.py ....                                         [ 79%]
tests/maskers/test_tabular.py FFFF                                       [ 82%]
tests/plots/test_bar.py s                                                [ 83%]
tests/plots/test_decision.py .                                           [ 84%]
tests/plots/test_dependence.py ..                                        [ 86%]
tests/plots/test_dependence_string_features.py .....                     [ 90%]
tests/plots/test_force.py FF                                             [ 92%]
tests/plots/test_heatmap.py ss                                           [ 94%]
tests/plots/test_image.py ...                                            [ 96%]
tests/plots/test_text.py .                                               [ 97%]
tests/plots/test_violin.py s                                             [ 98%]
tests/plots/test_waterfall.py ss                                         [100%]

=================================== FAILURES ===================================
______________________________ test_raw_function _______________________________

    def test_raw_function():
        """ Make sure passing a simple masking function works.
        """
    
>       X, _ = shap.datasets.boston()

tests/maskers/test_custom.py:12: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
/nix/store/63gixr2mi1jryln1yb1vbyvb833rmyyy-python3.10-shap-0.41.0/lib/python3.10/site-packages/shap/datasets.py:34: in boston
    d = sklearn.datasets.load_boston()
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

name = 'load_boston'

    def __getattr__(name):
        if name == "load_boston":
            msg = textwrap.dedent(
                """
                `load_boston` has been removed from scikit-learn since version 1.2.
    
                The Boston housing prices dataset has an ethical problem: as
                investigated in [1], the authors of this dataset engineered a
                non-invertible variable "B" assuming that racial self-segregation had a
[...]
```

`load_bosten` is used at [two places](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/search?q=load_boston).
